Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) unit is constructed with Ni-YSZ as the anode, YSZ as the electrolyte, and La(0.6)Sr(0.4)CoO(3)-Ce(0.9)Gd(0.1)O(1.95) as the cathode.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The SOFC operation is performed at 600 degrees C with a cathode gas simulating the lean-burn engine exhaust and at various fixed voltage, at open-circuit voltage, and with an inert gas flowing over the anode side, respectively.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical enhancement of NO decomposition occurs when an operating voltage is generated; higher O(2) concentration leads to higher enhancement.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Smaller NO concentration results in larger NO conversion.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Higher operating voltage and higher O(2) concentration can lead to both higher NO conversion and lower fuel consumption.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The molar rate of the consumption of the anode fuel can be very much smaller than that of NO to N(2) conversion.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This makes the anode fuel consumed in the SOFC-DeNO(x) process to be much less than the equivalent amount of ammonia consumed in the urea-based selective catalytic reduction process.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Additionally, the NO conversion increases with the addition of propylene and SO(2) into the cathode gas.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: These are beneficial for the application of the SOFC-DeNO(x) technology on treating diesel and other lean-burn engine exhausts.
Titulo: Electrochemical Enhancement of Nitric Oxide Removal from Simulated Lean-Burn Engine Exhaust via Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
